info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Transylvania, northwestern Henderson and south central Buncombe Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Brevard, or near Etowah, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Arden, Mills River, Fletcher, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Bent Creek, B.R. Parkway-Mount Pisgah To The Nc Arboretum and Asheville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
